intro: Galium moldavicum, commonly known as Moldavian bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium moldavicum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
